explains: adj. 庄严的；有尊严的；高贵的
v. 使高贵（dignify 的过去式）

sentences.cn: 她一言不发，以保持尊严。

sentences.en: Throughout his trial he maintained a dignified silence.
sentences.cn: 在整个审讯过程中，他始终沉默以保持尊严。

sentences.en: Colin put on his favorite air of dignified indifference to opinion.
sentences.cn: 柯林摆出他最喜欢的威严架势，对别人的观点十分冷漠。
